channel.title: Lifestyle on Rebecca
channel.description: Recent content in Lifestyle on Rebecca

item.title: CDC Covid case
item.description: Let us revisit the CDC Covid-19 Case Surveillance Data. There are well over 3 million entries of individual, de-identified patient data. # URL link to CDC to download data url <- "https://data.cdc.gov/api/views/vbim-akqf/rows.csv?accessType=DOWNLOAD" covid_data <- vroom(url)%>% clean_names() Based on the data, we could produce two graphs that show death % rate: by age group, sex, and whether the patient had co-morbidities or not by age group, sex, and whether the patient was admited to Intensive Care Unit (ICU) or not.

item.title: About me
item.description: About me Nice to meet you! I’m Hui Sheng from Suzhou, China. Currently I’m a master in financial analysis student in London Business School. This is my portfolio website. Feel free to contact me! My hobbies Piano. I have been playing the piano for more than 15 years and music has become an indispensable part of my life. Chopin is my favorite, whose nocturnes, ballads and etudes deeply impress me.

item.title: Value vs Growth stocks
item.description: Value vs Growth Stocks A Performance Analysis of Two Different Types of Stocks Until the last decade, it was a conventional consensus, that value investing outperformed growth investing, especially in long-term holding periods. From Kenneth R. French’s personal website, we can get annual and monthly returns of different portfolios constructed according to their BE/ME values from 1927 to 2020. In order to compare the performances of value and growth investment, we choose the portfolio with the highest 10% BE/ME value as a representative of value stocks, and portfolio with the lowest 10% BE/ME value as a representative of growth stocks.

item.title: Risk-Return of DJIA stocks
item.description: Returns of financial stocks Let’s choose the Dow Jones Industrial Aveareg (DJIA) stocks and their ticker symbols and download some data. Besides the thirty stocks that make up the DJIA, we will also add SPY which is an SP500 ETF (Exchange Traded Fund). djia_url <- "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dow_Jones_Industrial_Average" #get tables that exist on URL tables <- djia_url %>% read_html() %>% html_nodes(css="table") # parse HTML tables into a dataframe called djia. # Use purr::map() to create a list of all tables in URL djia <- map(tables, .

item.title: Ipsum
item.description: Nullam et orci eu lorem consequat tincidunt vivamus et sagittis magna sed nunc rhoncus condimentum sem. In efficitur ligula tate urna. Maecenas massa sed magna lacinia magna pellentesque lorem ipsum dolor. Nullam et orci eu lorem consequat tincidunt. Vivamus et sagittis tempus.
